Install Git on your computer and configu: Install Git on your computer and configure your name and email.
Git is free {/str/}open source software{: Git is free {/str/}open source software{/str_e/} (the {/lnk_git/}source code is public{/lnk_e/}) written by Linus Torvalds who also wrote the Linux operating system's kernel.
Git is a program for keeping track of ch: Git is a program for keeping track of changes over time, known in programming as {/str/}version control{/str_e/}. If you've used a track changes feature in a text editing software then you're already familiar with the concept!
We recommend installing Git on your comp: We recommend installing Git on your computer by installing the {/lnk_git/}latest version{/lnk_e/} from the Git website.
{/str/}Windows{/str_e/}: Use the {/str/}: {/str/}Windows{/str_e/}: Use the {/str/}Git Shell{/str_e/} for your terminal.
{/str/}Mac{/str_e/}: You can use the {/s: {/str/}Mac{/str_e/}: You can use the {/str/}terminal{/str_e/} app as your terminal.
Already have Git or not sure? Type {/cde: Already have Git or not sure? Type {/cde/}git --version{/cde_e/} in your terminal and if it returns a version number higher than {/cde/}1.7.10{/cde_e/}, you're set! For more information, visit the {/lnk_git/}Git website{/lnk_e/}.
On Windows, you are able to set quite a: On Windows, you are able to set quite a few options while installing Git. Normally, you can leave all of these options as they are set by default. However, if you have never heard of Vim as a text editor, then you might want to choose a different default editor, as Vim is relatively complex to handle. So pay a little attention to which options are set during installation.
Git on its own isn't like other programs: Git on its own isn't like other programs on your computer. You'll likely not see an icon on your desktop, but it will always be available to you and you'll be able to access it at any time from your terminal or Git desktop applications.
GitHub provides such an desktop applicat: GitHub provides such an desktop application, the {/lnk_desktop/}GitHub Desktop{/lnk_e/} app. The GitHub Desktop app can do a lot of things with Git but not all, which is why learning the terminal is important. But once you've got that down, you'll be glad to have the desktop app because it organizes your project's information more visually, like the GitHub website.

Dollar signs {/cde/}${/cde_e/} are often: Dollar signs {/cde/}${/cde_e/} are often used in programming documentation to signify that the line is {/str/}command line{/str_e/} code (see the code snippets above). You don't actually type the {/cde/}${/cde_e/} in though, only type what comes after.
